meanings.definition: To keep watch over students during an examination.
meanings.sent1: The teacher invigilates the students during the test.
meanings.sent2: She always invigilates the exam to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent3: The cat invigilates the mice during their cheese-eating contest.
meanings.sent4: The security camera invigilates the parking lot, catching any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent5: The vigilant guard invigilates the museum, protecting the valuable artifacts.

meanings.definition: To supervise or monitor a situation closely.
meanings.sent1: The manager invigilates the employees to ensure they follow the rules.
meanings.sent2: He invigilates the construction site to maintain safety standards.
meanings.sent3: The robot invigilates the factory, making sure everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The eagle invigilates its territory, watching for any intruders.
meanings.sent5: The detective invigilates the suspect, waiting for a slip-up in the alibi.
